name: Gamekeeper's Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here last year during the Dickensian weekend at Grassington and as all the hotels were full we tried this which is a short busride away from Grassington. The rooms are comfortable with a bath which was brilliant and the resteraunt food was faultless. Breakfast was excellent and the staff very friendly.i would recomend this place all year round
reviews.title: set in fantastic countryside

reviews.text: Came back for the third time this year .If you are looking for somewhere to stay in the dales for a reasonable price you wont find much better than this. Good quality pub food, very friendly staff and use of the gym and swimming pool.
reviews.title: Try it you will like it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We we staying at the adjacent Caravan Club campsite and visited for a drink and meal on our first night. It was so good we went again on our second night. The menu is excellent, the food delicious and the staff outstanding. Can't wait to visit the area again so we can once again have a drink and meal at The Gamekeeper's. Thank you for first class service.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Excellent Place
reviews.text: Lovely decor in rooms. Pub has a great homely, cosy feel and quality of the food being served is excellent. Leisure facilities are good, really recommend this place. We stayed for one night but will return for longer next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very relaxing weekend,could have stayed a lot longer,Room was excellent as was the food in the restaurant.All the staff were unfailingly pleasant as was,strangely, the weather.we will definitely be staying again later on in the year.We'll probably take our Grandchildren so they can try out the pool
reviews.title: Davidio 123

reviews.text: Fish pie not warm and very salty and the sticky ribs dry and hard other 3 meals in our group not bad. But overall very poor
reviews.title: Poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this restaurant twice because the staff were so attentive and the food was cooked to our requirements. We had visited other restaurants that were recommended and they were not a patch on the gamekeeper.
reviews.title: Restaurant

reviews.text: As a party of seven cyclists pedalling our way around the Yorkshire Dales we were so pleased that we chose to stay at the Gamekeepers Inn for three nights.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After being extremely helpful during several telephone conversations whilst arranging the 'logistics' of our four rooms, Liz's welcome on arrival was exceptional. She helped us with our bikes, showed us around, and explained, in depth, about the facilities (leisure, pool, and laundry) and how to operate them. Lovely conscientious friendly girl!
reviews.title: We really love this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gamekeeper's Inn is situated on a secluded caravan site and its facilities suited us well. The rooms are newly decorated, stylish, immaculately clean, and finished to a high standard.
reviews.title: heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent a couple of nights in the area, and the Gamekeepers was the closest pub. We ate there twice ; Monday was steak night, all steaks off the menu a tenner. Quite possibly the best steak I have EVER had ; they were cooked to perfection and served with piping hot chips, delicious steak and very good portion size. The service was very good and the staff all very friendly.
reviews.title: Best Steak ; Ever?

reviews.text: We went back a couple of nights later for the quiz night and even though it was "pie night" we both ate from the main menu ; I had sea bass and had 2 full size fillets on stir fried veg (not the scruffy little square portion I have been served in other places), my hubby had chorizo stuffed chicken breast and it was again a really good sized portion and very tasty. The staff were different to the other night, but the service was just as good,
reviews.title: Fantastic will be going again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: its a shame we had to leave when we did, as the food and service was brilliant and we would have gone back again
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: (the only recommendation I would make is Sky sports to watch the football on, but I understand how expensive it is and it may not be feasible for a small business)
reviews.title: What a fantastic weekend

reviews.text: Stayed at the Gamekeepers Inn for a girls weekend away.I LOVED IT.The rooms are all high standards and are very clean.The food is fantastic ,very high standards,feels like youre in a top restaurant but only at a fraction of the price.The spa next door is also very nice with large pool and all the extras you find at a spa.Will be going again very soon with the hubby.
reviews.title: What a fantastic place!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here after a long day riding. I was welcomed and put at ease straight away. A safe place for my bike found before a visit to the spa facilities next door and then a superb meal. Room was comfy and very clean with everything I needed - especially the homemade biscuits! Breakfast was plentiful and very good quality. As a solo female traveller I felt at ease and well looked after. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Gamekeepers Inn after a long day of caving and found the lady serving in the bar to be very helpful and attentive. The family room was fabulous with lounge (pull out bed) and bedroom with a tv in each. There are leisure facilities on site and whilst not the best I have been to. are adequate to keep the children entertained on a gloomy afternoon. THe food in the restaraunt was excellent (very big portions) my children are good eaters but they were unable to tweak the dishes to suit their pallets so ended up with childrens meal which was ok. Overall would recommend if staying in the Yorkshire Dales.
reviews.title: Gamekeepers Inn

reviews.text: Stayed for one night in July and really wish we'd stayed a bit longer as we enjoyed it so much. The rooms are spacious and clean, with a comfy bed. We got free use of the neighbouring leisure club with its pool, sauna, steam room and Jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was absolutely amazing; I was jealous of every dish that I didn't order!
reviews.title: excellent meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's in an ideal location where you can have a quiet holiday or take a trip into Skipton if you want to go sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great gamekeepers

description: The Gamekeeper's Inn has recently been fully refurbished from top to bottom and our friendly team are waiting to welcome you whether you are popping in for a beer or fancy staying for Bed and Breakfast or even one of our spa breaks! Room prices include a full Yorkshire breakfast using fresh local produce and hotel guests receive free use of our swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna and gym. We serve freshly prepared homemade food using local ingredients daily 12 noon to 2pm and 6pm until 9pm. The bar is open daily 12 noon to 11pm. We serve a range of cask conditioned ales, a full range of wines and spirits and of course a cracking range of malt whiskey all for you to enjoy in the comfort of the bar, by the log burner or in our stunning conservatory dining room.
